column5: Had the dayoff today and decided to run some errands with my son.  Decided to stop by a sports store, think it was Athletes World?  As we were walking around, heard the girls in a panic while they spoke with what appeared their head office.  Appears their server was down and head office was trying to walk them through trouble-shooting it.  They were not too pleased since they knew nothing about computers and customers getting denied on their purchases, returns.... Well, I stepped in and informed them that I know about computers, after all, that is what I do for a living.  After they heard that, they pretty much hung up the phone. After getting their server up and running again and diagnosing that their bar code scanner is doa, they were quite ecstatic.  I was about to leave knowing I did a good deed, they stopped me and asked to leave my phone #.  Got a call a few hours later that they got a $50 gift certificate for me and an employee discount on any purchase for life, haha.  I tell ya, its good to know about computers.
Just don't call me a NERD.
If I was getting free gift cards at stores I wouldn't care what anyone would call me.
Think I should start peddling my services at fishing stores now.  Think I'm on to something here.
Good for you and them, you did it to help them and they showed you that they appreciated it!

Oh man, now you will be getting regular phone calls.  "Thanks for fixing us up the other day, but ever since then we are having X problem and it is causing Y to run really slow"  As rick said...GEEK! lol  Tony
Hey...can you get me something on your store discount??? LOL j/k.  Good for you....it's great to see people helping others and then seeing the appreciation that comes along with it!
Good one you! I'm thinking RETAINER!!!!! HH
Hey that's great.  I like when companies appreciate the generosity of the average joe helping out when they need it.  Makes me feel all warm and tingly inside  Joey
Ooops, double post.  DOH! - See how excited I got

well thats very good for you and for them,and its even better that they knew it was a serious problemand they would have to maybe close the store or not accept any debit or credit cards,so you probobly saved them lots of money in lost sales so everybody wins...thats cool   it proves again that us OFC,members are the best people there is....cheers
